components.description:
A red rose. Depicted as a single, vertical red rose on a green stem.

Commonly used for Valentine’s Day, Mother’s Day, and other special occasions. May be more generally used to express such sentiments as love and romance. Also used as a symbol of socialism or as a red accent color.

Not to be confused with ðŸŒ· Tulip, though their applications may overlap.

Samsung’s rose was previously pink.

title: Rose

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Plant symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A single red rose emoji. SometimesÂ usedÂ as a display of romance,Â or for their pleasant smell. Rose was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 20 http://emojipedia.org/rose/
emoji_net_data.name: rose

bn:00033885n: A celebration of lovers that is observed on February 14.
Saint Valentine's Day, commonly shortened to Valentine's Day, is an annual commemoration held on February 14 celebrating love and affection between intimate companions. Day

February 14 Quotes of the day from previous years:; 2004; 2005; 2006; 2007; 2008; 2009; 2010; 2011; 2012; 2013; 2014; 2015; 2016: Rank or add further suggestions. Ranking system: Love does not dominate, it cultivates. 14
A day for the exchange of tokens of affection
Saint Valentine's Day, also known as Valentine's Day or the Feast of Saint Valentine, is a holiday observed on February 14 each year.

bn:00073636n: Â  Traditionally the first of the four seasons of the year in temperate regions, in which plants spring from the ground and trees come into blossom, following winter and preceding summer.
One of the four temperate seasons
The season of spring, between winter and summer.
Traditionally the first of the four seasons, the season of growth with an ever increasing amount of daytime.
Spring is one of the four conventional temperate seasons, following winter and preceding summer.
Spring is one of the four seasons of temperate zones, the transition from winter into summer.

bn:00035378n: The reproductive structure of angiosperm plants, consisting of stamens and carpels surrounded by petals and sepals all borne on the receptacle.
A flower lacking sepals, petals, stamens, or carpels.
Flowers, sometimes known as blooms or blossoms, are the reproductive structures found in flowering plants.
A flower, sometimes known as a bloom or blossom, is the reproductive structure found in flowering plants.
Structure found in some plants (division Magnoliophyta / angiosperms) to support reproduction
A plant cultivated for its blooms or blossoms

bn:00052121n: Love is a variety of different feelings, states, and attitudes that ranges from interpersonal affection to pleasure.
An intense feeling of affection and care towards another person.
A strong positive emotion of regard and affection
In the Italian or Latin languages
The form of romantic affection that is considered pure and wholly positive, not just based on feelings of lust.

Love is a word which refers to a variety of different emotional states, feelings or attitudes which range from those of simple personal pleasures or desires to those characterizing interpersonal affection and many forms of profound kindness, compassion, and benevolent concern for the good of others.

bn:00068283n: A flower of the rose plant.
A rose is a woody perennial of the genus Rosa, within the family Rosaceae.
Any of many shrubs of the genus Rosa that bear roses
A flower of the rose plant (Rosa).
Roses are perennial plants of the genus Rosa, within the family Rosaceae.
